legacy.description: Cofounder & CEO @JarsyInc | Pre-IPO Access, Reimagined.

result.text:
为什么说AI-native的一代会比之前的几代厉害十倍甚至百倍？

因为其实每一代人并不是更聪明，而是可调用的外部能力边界被整体抬升了。现在 AI-native 是第一次把认知能力本身外包给基础设施的一代。

回头看，Gen Y 学会用搜索引擎，Gen Z 学会用移动应用，AI-native的Gen Beta 从小学会的是直接对话一个可推理，可总结，可生成，可纠错的系统。

Gen Beta 从一开始就默认不需要自己从零构建知识框架，不需要自己独立搜索碎片信息，不需要先学会格式语法流程。先表达意图，系统帮他补全路径。

这意味着抽象能力提前解锁。过去是先学细节才能谈结构，现在是先拥有结构再逐步理解细节。所以这是学习范式的根本反转。

他们更早学会如何让世界为自己工作。Gen Y 的核心技能是会找资料，Gen Z 的核心技能是会用App，AI-native 的核心技能是会拆问题。

他们从小就习惯把一个模糊目标拆成子问题，不断追问，更正，逼近最优解，通过对话推动系统产出结果。这会内化成一种人格，世界是可以被对齐的，而不是只能被适应的。长期看这种人更像 builder 而不是 operator。

AI越发展，试错成本也接近于零。过去学一项技能要看书上课练习失败再练，反馈速度是按周算，按月算。现在问AI，让AI生成示例，让AI指出错误，让AI给优化版本，反馈回路压缩到按秒算。进化速度的差距不是两倍，而是指数级。这会导致能力分布曲线被拉成陡峭的幂律，少数超级个体远远甩开平均水平。

他们也更容易形成系统级思维，因为从小就在和系统对话而不是只和人对话。AI天然暴露输入推理输出，约束优化收敛，假设验证修正。这些结构会变成他们的思考默认模板，所以他们更容易设计流程，构建框架，做平台级产品，搭系统而不是做功能。

真正的代差不在智商，在可调用认知宽度与深度。智商分布几千年都差不多，变化的是一个12岁的孩子现在可以随时调用博士级解释，工程师级方案，投资人级分析，作家级表达。这相当于个体加上云端认知集群，不是一个人在思考，是一个人指挥一支思考军团。

为什么是十倍百倍而不是渐进？因为这是工具升级叠加行为模式升级叠加思维结构升级叠加人格结构升级。不是线性改良，是物种级的工作方式迁移。

Gen Y学会在系统里生存，Gen Z学会在平台上套利，而 AI-native 从出生开始就知道世界是可以被指令化的。

当一个世代把指挥智能当成天然时，他们与前代的差距注定不是渐进，而是断层。

result.text:
WHY WE SHOULD GO TO MARS: ELON MUSK ON SECURING THE FUTURE OF CONSCIOUSNESS
Going to Mars isn’t about escape—it’s about insurance. It’s about making sure the light of consciousness doesn’t go out if something catastrophic happens on Earth. Elon has consistently framed the Mars mission as the single most important step humanity can take to ensure long-term survival and expansion.

“The key branching point for human destiny or destiny of consciousness as a whole is that Mars is self-sustaining, even if the resupply ships from Earth stop coming. You’re not multiplanetary until the planet can grow by itself. Because there’s always some risk of technology on Earth falling below a certain level or of a nuclear war or a meteor. You haven’t secured the future of civilization and consciousness until both planets can survive independently.”

This is why Mars matters:
•  Backup for humanity — A second home protects against single-point failures (asteroids, supervolcanoes, pandemics, nuclear conflict, AI misalignment, etc.).
•  Self-sustaining civilization — Once Mars can grow its own population and industry without constant Earth resupply, consciousness becomes multiplanetary and far more resilient.
•  Inspiration & progress driver — The challenge forces breakthroughs in energy, life support, materials, AI, and closed-loop systems that benefit Earth too.
•  Long-term species survival — Staying on one fragile planet forever is a gamble with extinction-level risks. Mars turns that into a hedge.

Every Starship launch, every refueling test, every iteration brings us closer to that branching point. It’s not luxury—it’s the ultimate act of responsibility toward future generations.

做好了，叫 Confirmo，目前只是一个针对于 claude code 的桌面宠物，可能唯一有意思的是它开箱即用不需要任何配置，无缝、无感、自动、毫无侵入性地默默监听你的 claude code 是否在干活儿，当 claude code 在干活儿或者已经干完了活儿会给你及时的实时响应。而且没有任何隐私问题，因为全程不联网，只是在监听本地的 sessions jsonl 文件变动而已。

那么为什么做个针对 claude code 的桌面宠物呢？因为 Vibe Coding 的时候我等得太无聊了，我已经想过很多解决无聊的方法了，嗑瓜子也已经无法掩盖我的无聊了，多个并行的任务也无法让我不无聊了，我就是无聊，无可奈何的无聊，那么无聊的时候最应该该干什么呢？就是拉一个人跟你一起无聊，那么不如有个桌面宠物一起陪我无聊，所以它诞生了，嘻嘻

result.text:
如果你最近看到很多人在聊 Clawdbot，建议你不需要跟风去安装测试，也不必焦虑没有用上它会错过什么。

Clawdbot 是什么？

Clawdbot 是一个开源的本地优先个人 AI 智能体项目，由开发者 Peter Steinberger 和社区共同维护，吉祥物是只龙虾🦞。它可以运行在 macOS、Linux 和 Windows（通过 WSL2）上，核心理念是让你在自己的硬件上运行一个完全本地化的 AI 助手。

它能做什么？

Clawdbot 内置了浏览器控制、Canvas 画布、定时任务等工具，可以帮你浏览网页、填写表单、读写文件、执行 Shell 命令。更关键的是它支持多渠道接入：WhatsApp、Telegram、Slack、Discord、Signal、iMessage、Microsoft Teams 等等都能连，这意味着你可以通过这些聊天应用远程操控你的电脑。

为什么大家都在买 Mac Mini？

很多用户把 Clawdbot 部署在一台专用的 Mac Mini 上作为"永不休息的AI助手"。有用户分享说他通过 Telegram 监控 Claude 编码会话，让 Clawdbot 自动拉取代码仓库、打开 VS Code、运行测试、生成修复、自动提交。还有人说"躺在床上看 Netflix 的时候，通过 Telegram 重建了整个网站"。

它能自动化几乎所有你在电脑上能做的事情。所以最佳实践是专门用一台电脑跑 Clawdbot，让它可以随意操作，一时间让这些天 Mac Mini 销量大增。

需要注意什么？

官方强烈推荐使用 Anthropic Pro/Max 订阅配合 Claude Opus 4.5 模型，以获得更好的长上下文能力和提示词注入防护。另外，Anthropic 最近修改了 Claude Code OAuth tokens 的权限，限制只能在 Claude Code 内部使用，不能用于外部 API 调用 ，所以现在需要单独配置 Anthropic API key 才能正常使用。

result.text:
WHY STARSHIP NEEDS TO BE SO MASSIVE: ELON MUSK EXPLAINS THE SCALE FOR MARS

Elon has repeatedly emphasized that Starship’s enormous size—nearly 400 ft tall, over 5,000 tons fueled, ~1,200 tons of propellant—is no accident. 

It’s engineered for the massive tonnage required to build a self-sustaining city on Mars, far beyond what smaller rockets could ever achieve affordably or practically.

“It’s designed to make life multiplanetary, otherwise extreme overkill for mere Earth sector activity! Starship fleet mass to orbit per year will be more than 1000 times all current Earth rockets combined, including Falcon. 
Necessary, for a city on Mars.”

This massive scale unlocks:
•  Hundreds of tons per flight to orbit (reusable 100–150+ tons, pushing higher in future versions) — critical for habitats, ISRU plants, power systems, and crew in fleet quantities.
•  Orbital refueling efficiency — Huge propellant volume means fewer tanker launches to fill up for Mars transit.
•  Rapid, high-cadence production — To deliver millions of tons over time, only a vehicle this big + fully reusable enables airline-like launch rates without bankrupting the effort.

Smaller rockets? They’d need thousands of launches for what Starship fleets do in dozens—impractical for colonization timelines. Size = necessity for the tonnage bottleneck.

Every test flight refines this beast. The path to millions of tons on Mars starts with building big. Which upgrade—V4 thrust jumps, stretched tanks, or fleet-scale cadence—has you most pumped? Let’s accelerate to multiplanetary. 🚀🔴🌌

- The post spotlights a January 16, 2026, DOJ lawsuit against Virginia's election commissioner, citing a 33.2% duplicate voter registration rate in 2024—over 2.5 times the national average of 12.7%—as evidence of inadequate roll maintenance under the National Voter Registration Act.

- Replies criticize Republican officials like AG Jason Miyares and Gov. Glenn Youngkin for inaction during their tenure, tying the issue to recent Democratic victories in Virginia and a proposed bill by Rep. Abigail Spanberger to restrict hand-counting of ballots.

result.text:
THE ECONOMY IS NOT A MAGIC HORN OF PLENTY, IF YOU DON’T MAKE STUFF, THERE’S NO STUFF

Some people have this absurd view that the economy is like some magic horn of plenty. Like it just makes stuff

Whatever it is, there’s a magic horn of plenty, and the goods and services just come from this magic horn of plenty. Like if somebody has more stuff than somebody else, it’s because they took more from this magic horn of plenty

Now, let me just break it to the fools out there if you don’t make stuff, there’s no stuff. If you don’t make the food, if you don’t process the food, if you don’t transport the food, you become detached from reality

You can't just legislate money and solve these things. If you don’t make stuff, there is no stuff obviously. We’ll run out of the stores, and the whole machine just grinds to a halt

result.text:
Common Sense
Introduction
This piece is written deliberately in the voice and cadence of America's first warnings. The plain-spoken moral clarity of Thomas Paine. The thunder of Patrick Henry. The constitutional indictment of Thomas Jefferson.
Not because we live in the eighteenth century. Because the abuses we are being asked to tolerate are the same abuses our founding generation named without hesitation.
They did not call lawlessness "policy." They did not call state violence "complicated." They called it what it was.
And they acted like free people.
To the People of the United States
They killed a man for helping a woman off the ground. They called him a terrorist.
They entered homes without judicial warrant. They called it law.
They shot a mother in her car. They called it enforcement.
They defamed the dead before the bodies were cold. They called it truth.
We have names for this. We used them in 1776.
When officers of the Crown could enter any home, search any vessel, seize any paper, without showing cause to any judge, we called it tyranny.
When the King's men could arrest colonists and ship them abroad for trial, denying them the judgment of their neighbors, we called it tyranny.
When government punished speech, assembly, and petition as sedition, we called it tyranny.
When those in power declared their critics enemies of the state, we called it tyranny.
Now we watch the same abuses revived by men who swear oaths to the Constitution while treating it as an obstacle.
They do not argue with the Fourth Amendment. They ignore it. They do not debate the rights of citizens. They bypass them. They do not refute their critics. They libel them. They do not meet lawful restraint with lawful reason. They meet it with a gun and a label.
And the label is meant to do what bayonets once did. Silence the mind before it speaks.
What is a "terrorist," in their mouth? It is not a man with a bomb. It is a man with an idea. What is an "insurrectionist"? It is not a man with a plot. It is a man with a voice. What is "public safety"? It is the old phrase by which every free people has been trained to accept the shackles.
Let us be clear.
A government that kills its citizens and then lies about them is not protecting you. It is warning you.
A government that enters homes on its own authority answers to no one. Today it is their door. Tomorrow it is yours.
A government that calls witnesses "assailants," protesters "insurrectionists," and nurses "terrorists" is not describing reality. It is constructing a pretext.
The first step is to make fear the public religion. The second is to make obedience a civic virtue. The third is to make resistance a crime by definition.
We did not risk our lives, our fortunes, and our sacred honor so that future generations could trade liberty for the illusion of safety.
We did not write a Constitution so that it could be set aside by memorandum.
We did not declare independence from one tyrant so that our descendants could elect another and call it self-government.
The Constitution is not a decoration. It is a chain placed on power. And if power may break that chain whenever it pleases, then what you have is not a republic. You have a ruler.
The question is what you will do.
Will you wait for hearings that will change nothing?
Will you hope courts will save you while judges look away, while officials smirk and say, Let them sue, as if rights were merely paperwork?
Will you tell yourself it is not your concern because they have not yet come for you?
This is how every people has lost its freedom. Not all at once, but piece by piece, until the final piece is taken and they discover, too late, that nothing remains to defend.
They took Kilmar Abrego Garcia. Deported him despite a court order. Imprisoned him in El Salvador. When forced to bring him back, charged him with crimes. When he fought back, tried to send him to Uganda, Ghana, Liberia. Now they face a hearing on whether the prosecution was vindictive all along.
They took Rumeysa Öztürk. For an op-ed. Their own documents show they knew they had no evidence. They branded her a terrorist anyway.
They killed Renee Good. Shot in her car.
They killed Alex Pretti. Helping a woman off the ground.
Say their names. Your government will not.
Some will argue over particulars. That is how the timid avoid the principle. They will litigate every detail, quarrel over every moment, demand perfection from the victim, and then declare the execution justified when perfection cannot be proven.
That is not justice. That is ritual.
The essence of tyranny is not that it always kills. It is that it claims the right to kill without accountability. And then demands your agreement afterward.
If you will not speak now, when?
If you will not act now, why do you imagine you will act later?
The chains are always light at first. That is how they get you to wear them. They begin as exceptions. They end as habits. They begin as policies. They end as a system. They begin at the margins. They end at your door.
We pledged our lives, our fortunes, and our sacred honor. What will you pledge?
Or will you pledge nothing, risk nothing, say nothing, and hope the crocodile eats you last?
That is not citizenship.
That is not liberty.
That is not what we built.
You inherited a revolution. Now defend it.
Speak. Write. March. Vote. Sue. Organize. Resist with every lawful tool your Constitution provides.
That is the work.
Violence is not resistance. Violence is the excuse they are waiting for. Deny them. Starve them of it. Let them be exposed in the full light of law and conscience.
Let your resistance be disciplined. Let it be relentless. Let it be peaceful and unafraid. Let it be public enough that lies cannot suffocate it in darkness.
The Republic is not dead.
But it is bleeding.
And no one is coming to save it but you.

result.text:
这一段时间 baoyu-skills 项目更新很频繁，但基本都基于这样一个迭代模式：

1. 发现问题
比如我今天发现 commit messages 都是没有意义的版本号变更，虽然有 CHANGELOG，但这不利于后续维护

另外就是版本号的变更当前都是 Agent 决定，有时候其实我想自己控制，但是又懒的写要求

再有就是还得手动 push origin，还是懒

2. 分析问题
要让 commit messages 变得有意义，把每个skills/模块的变更变成独立的commit，版本号的变更跟以前保持一致就可以。

3. 解决问题
不需要手动去执行，把要求发给 Claude Code，这种可以几句话描述清楚的直接交给它做就可以了。

4. 验证问题
做完当然需要验证一下，看是不是符合预期。先看变更记录，再测试（有些甚至可以告诉 Agent 验证方法让它自己验证），测试下来跟我期望的一样，如果不一致就要回到原来的会话告诉 Agent 我期望的结果和实际结果的差异，让它修复

https://t.co/GOjnWisJjw
